title: Pressure rises on Reeves as government borrowing costs hit 27-year high
summary: The Chancellor is set to have reduced fiscal flexibility in the upcoming budget due to a rise in the yield of 30-year bonds, which has climbed to 5.68%. This increase may impact government borrowing costs and fiscal planning. The constraints could affect investment and spending decisions moving forward.

title: Belgium to recognise Palestinian state at UN and sanction Israel – Middle East crisis live
summary: The foreign minister clarified that the recent actions are not directed at the Israeli people but are intended to compel their government to adhere to international and humanitarian law. This statement emphasizes a focus on governmental accountability rather than targeting citizens. The remark highlights ongoing tensions regarding compliance with legal norms in the region.

title: Afternoon Update: Katter distances himself from neo-Nazi-linked megaphone; FoI transparency backlash; and ‘cosmic’ algae in Melbourne
summary: A veteran politician spoke at an anti-immigration rally in Townsville, addressing the crowd using a microphone linked to the National Socialist Network. His appearance at the event has sparked controversy and criticism. The rally is part of ongoing tensions surrounding immigration policies in the region.
